text: creatures like the giant guitar fish a
type of Ray that gets its name from its
guitar shaped body can't blink instead
they retract their eyeballs pulling the
organs almost completely into their
heads now new research shows the fish
have that ability thanks to a special
eye muscle the same muscle in sharks who
don't retract their eyes is smaller and
attaches the eye to the middle of the
eye socket
but in Guitar fish the muscle is larger
and longer it connects the eye to the
underside of the skull giving the
creatures an increased range of motion
that helps the animal protect their eyes
like our eyelids do when we blink just
don't challenge these tropical fish to a
staring contest you're sure to lose
[Music]
